column4: I have a very quick question for anyone who knows anything about bash scripting, how does one define a varible during the time of exicution. For example: sh ./myscript.sh VARIBLE! VARIBLE2
check the advanced bash scripting guide - it has chapters on 'arguments'
i cant rember the exact syntax but its somthing like $1 $2 and $3 become the valiues
watch out for spacwes in arguments
